text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.

- Finance Minister Antonio Sousa Franco said Prime Minister Antonio Guterres should be the one to make decisions on awarding state guarantees until a parliamentary inquiry into a guaranteed loan to the General Workers Union is completed.

- A European Commission study of the Portuguese economy concluded that its most serious problem is the poor quality of its education. A sharp increase in social security spending between 1990 and 1995 indicated that spending controls were not strict enough.
- State electricity company EDP - Electricidade de Portugal has opened a plant in northern Portugal to produce electricity by wind power.
- Portugal's intelligence, immigration and police services have identified suspects whom they believe set fire to a discotheque in northern Portugal last week, killing 12 people.
- The Agriculture Minister Fernando Gomes da Silva is trying to obtain financial help from the EU for Portuguese farmers whose crops were harmed by this winter's dry weather.
- The Bank of Portugal forecast 1997 GDP of between 3.0 and 3.75 percent.
- Social security services have recovered 178.5 billion escudos in unpaid contributions, above the government's expectations of 100 to 125 billion escudos.
- The European Commission may bring a case against Portugal after a complaint from the pharmaceutical company Astra which says Portuguese companies have violated EU law on pharmaceutical copyright.
